block.p: It may just be true that, as William Safire suggests, ''some politically sensitive soul'' changed ''liquor store'' to ''package store'' in Senator Lieberman's acceptance speech (On Language, Oct. 1). But package store is not just (as Safire suggests) a dated or odd term, or even a ''business euphemism.'' It is normal regional English for a liquor store in much of Connecticut, and has been for decades. A search for ''package store'' in Southern New England Telephone's online yellow pages yields 250 hits in Connecticut.
Stephen Burt Jessica Bennett St. Paul
